analytic.title: Review of Nicolaas Pieter Jan Land, Anecdota Syriaca

monogr.title: Journal of sacred literature and Biblical record

biblStruct.note: THE acquisition of the Nitrian manuscripts by the British Museum has given a wonderful impulse to the study of the Syriac language; and the works published in this department of literature, during the last ten or fifteen years, exceed in number and importance the publications of any former period since the days of Widmanstad. Cureton led the way, to be quickly followed by his countrymen Payne Smith and Cowper, as well as by the German De Lagarde, the Dane Rordam, and the Italian Ceriani.
